title: How Far are LLMs from Being Our Digital Twins? A Benchmark for Persona-Based Behavior Chain Simulation
author: Rui Li (Peking University), Heming Xia (The Hong Kong Polytechnic University), Xinfeng Yuan (Fudan University), Qingxiu Dong (Peking University), Lei Sha (Beihang University), Wenjie Li (The Hong Kong Polytechnic University), Zhifang Sui (Peking University)
relevance_why: The paper introduces a framework for simulating human behavior, which can be leveraged in applications such as personalized audio-visual agents in the music domain or human-centric AI models in real-time interactive environments.
background: This research investigates how well large language models simulate continuous human behavior through a benchmark dataset consisting of detailed behavior chains derived from literature.
contribution: This paper introduces the BEHAVIOR-CHAIN benchmark to solve the inadequacies in evaluating LLMs for behavior simulation, achieving a comprehensive assessment of their performance in contextually evolving scenarios.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous evaluations primarily focus on dialogue simulation and fail to address dynamic human behavior tracking.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work highlights the continuous behavior simulation, utilizing persona-based datasets and a structured evaluation framework that examines both recognition and generation tasks.

key_innovation: The introduction of a persona-based behavior chain framework that assesses how LLMs adapt to and simulate complex behavioral sequences over time.
real_world_impact: The findings can enhance the development of digital twins, paving the way for more realistic virtual agents in various sectors, including personalized healthcare and interactive entertainment.
limitations: Limited to English-language Western literature, which may not represent global cultural contexts.

new_terms.digital twins: **Digital twins** refer to virtual models that replicate individual behaviors and can autonomously perform tasks or decision-making based on personal data.
new_terms.behavior chain: **Behavior chain** is a sequence of actions taken by personas within specific contextual settings, crucial for evaluating the continuity and coherence in simulated behavior.
